description.narrative: The system of social care services is reformed to effectively address the needs of the most vulnerable families and children.,which contributes to Public Finance And Local Governance, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: OUTCOME 2 - Child wellbeing data collection and management infrastructure in 12 Child Rights Units and 12 Child Rights Observatories fully established and 50 people trained, with a special focus on capturing social exclusion and marginalization (RKLA 8)

mailing-address.narrative: Rr. Skenderbej Ndertesa Volkswagen kati 3 Tirana Albania

sector.narrative: Cash Transfers: Delivery of cash transfers through government system (beneficiary identification, grievance mechanisms, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)

Cash Transfers: Technical support to government cash transfer system development and expansion (design, targeting, beneficiary selection, grievance mechanism, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)
ECD data, evidence, and knowledge generation and dissemination
National social protection strategies: Policies, strategies, legislation and coordination (inter-ministerial, donor)
PF4C - domestic revenue mobilization and access to finance for key social services
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities policy, planning and administration
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

title.narrative: Albania United Nations Development Assistance Framework
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Albania 2018 Annual Report on Results for Children
Albania 2019 Annual Report on Results for Children
Albania 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: The system of social care services is reformed to effectively address the needs of the most vulnerable families and children.

description.narrative: Adoption of Albania's new Law on Social Care Services was the highlight of 2016. Capacity building programme for newly formed Municipalities has started, to empower local governments to plan, budget and implement social protection policies, in line with the country's overall decentralization reform and the new Law on Local Self-Government. | Status:Met | As-of Date:12/01/2017

title.narrative: # of social workers (practicing case management) for 100,000 population

baseline.value: 1,300 social administrators distributing cash assistance, not dealing with case management

target.value: 2016:To be established (in line with Social Protection Strategy till 2020)

actual.value: 2017:100% of the Social Care Services reform pillars (i.e. addressing legislative, institutional, fiscal, capacity and data supply issues) are reflected in the national Social Protection Strategy for 2015-2020.

title.narrative: Existence of valid national social protection strategy and/or policy

baseline.value: Albania's Social Inclusion Stratgey for 2007-2013 expired

target.value: 2016:Albania's new Strategy of Social Protection till 2020 approved

actual.value: 2017:Albania's new Strategy of Social Protection till 2020 approved

title.narrative: Political commitment and accountability for social care service reform is reflected in national strategies and MoSWY's workplans

baseline.value: No explicit definition and regulations on community-based social care services (non-residential)

target.value: 2016:National strategies and MoSWY's workplans reflect 100% of the social care services reform targets

actual.value: 2017:The target of 10 professional social workers for 100,000 population has been established in the recently approved Law on Social Care Services, setting the standard for municipalities to approve/adjust their institutional structures/capacities accordantly.

title.narrative: in target areas, % of vulnerable children (inclduing Roma) not yet reached by "case managers" from the national social protection services

baseline.value: The new Law on Social Worker institutionalises the case management as a professional practice

target.value: 2016:In target areas, not more than 30% of vulnerable children still not reached

actual.value: 2017:The inclusion of Roma children has been progressively realized using several established sector- and project-based mechanisms at national and local level. The reporting of the indicator in value at this stage is constrained by non-availability of fully compatible data coming from different sources.
